title: Humanities
subject: Supplemental Standards for English Language Arts (2021-)

document.title: Utah Secondary Supplemental Standards for English Language Arts

85B9C631AEE54276A6DB52686115D22D.description:
Evaluate exemplary works’ and artifacts’ use of elements of form to
express human ideals within various cultures, places, and time periods.

33AC987103A24AB3A5F70C953BAEE832.description:
Analyze exemplary works and artifacts as a means of discovering and
expressing human ideals within various cultures, places, and time periods.

CE2C7092094F48D98799CE9FB0556E1E.description:
Compare human ideals as defined by different cultures, places, and time
periods.

8C4F722715C64689B48F891507C7C8DA.description:
Human Ideals: Students will examine the human need for discovering and expressing
 human ideals, for example, truth, love, joy, beauty, respect, or liberty, within various
cultures, places, and time periods.

874D9FD8D6AF4C12A923FF8D333CDED8.description:
Identify and evaluate potential aspects of motivation and inspiration in
the production of exemplary works and artifacts.

11312E4C14AF479CA12035F9FA56CFEC.description:
Examine exemplary works and artifacts as a means of expressing
information, thoughts, and ideals within various cultures, places, and time
periods.

599454417F864C49AFE0CD48A9465AE2.description:
Examine how the innate desire for purpose, meaning, and fulfillment
have motivated individuals to create exemplary works that express
information, thoughts, and ideals within various cultures, places, and time
periods.

851B9B74E38D4DE7A434645761F037A9.description:
Human Roles & Behavior: Students will examine how humans have elevated ideas,
customs, and social behaviors in societies through the cultivation and refinement of
literature, language, philosophy, fine arts, and performing arts throughout history.

FA8BD0D559084CDEA2E0841086439CAA.description:
Evaluate exemplary works and artifacts’ use of elements of form including
literary or artistic elements to express aspects of human nature.

9EC0040A36E04FCD81D483E8CCB1D28B.description:
Examine exemplary works and artifacts as a means of expressing
information, thoughts, and ideals within various cultures, places, and time
periods.

A6EC252A866C4D1BB5EB14AF1A548878.description:
Analyze the interrelationships of religion, morals, ethics, and aesthetics
present in the world’s societies.

75CBB019C23841A5AFC9E5047A645B86.description:
Human Nature: Students will explore what it means to be human throughout time by
 studying the physical, social, aesthetic, and spiritual aspects of human nature.
